page.title: 09FARMING -SOIL IN PANTON
page.content: {PANTON }soils do not lend themselves to growing many of the new crops.{ {PANTON }fields are best suited to growing crops of wheat, barley and oil-seed rape. The problems occurring in growing crops of potatoes and sugar beet are that the soil would not be suitable for lifting the crops in the wet autumn months and a quota system already exists for these two crops and acreages for growers are controlled by the Potato Marketing Board and the British Sugar Corporation. Livestock enterprises are declining due to the high-cost, high-risk factor of rearing and fattening cattle, sheep and pigs and this, combined with new eating patterns and diets, has caused a drop in demand.
